messages.name: Models
messages.description: Models represents a configured Large Language Model.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The unique resource name of the model.
Format: "models/{model_id}"
The {model_id} is a unique identifier for the model.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description:
A user-friendly display name for the model.
e.g., "My Local Model"

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A description of the model.
Optional field to provide additional context about the model.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: provider_name
fields.description: The name of the provider associated with this model.

fields.name: priority
fields.description:
The priority of the model.
Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
This value is used to order models when multiple models are eligible for
selection, such as when listing available models or choosing a default
model for a request. Clients may treat 0 as the lowest priority and use
larger values for models that should be preferred. When multiple models
share the same priority, their relative order is not guaranteed and may
be determined by other factors (for example, name or provider).
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CreateModelRequest
messages.description: Request message for creating a model.

fields.name: model
fields.description:
The model resource to create.
The `name` field should be left empty; the server will assign it.

messages.name: CreateModelResponse
messages.description: Response message for creating a model.

messages.name: DeleteModelRequest
messages.description: Request message for deleting a model.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The resource name of the model to delete.
Format: "models/{model_id}"

messages.name: DeleteModelResponse
messages.description: Response message for deleting a model.

messages.name: GetModelRequest
messages.description: Request message for retrieving a model.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The resource name of the model to retrieve.
Format: "models/{model_id}"

messages.name: GetModelResponse
messages.description: Response message for retrieving a model.

messages.name: ListModelsRequest
messages.description: Request message for listing models.

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: The maximum number of models to return.

fields.name: page_token
fields.description: A page token, received from a previous `ListModels` call.

messages.name: ListModelsResponse
messages.description: Response message for listing models.

fields.name: models
fields.description: A list of configured models.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: next_page_token
fields.description: A token to retrieve the next page of results.

messages.name: UpdateModelRequest
messages.description: Request message for updating a model.

fields.name: model
fields.description:
The model resource with updated fields.
The `name` field is used to identify the model to update.

fields.name: update_mask
fields.description: The list of fields to be updated.

messages.name: UpdateModelResponse
messages.description: Response message for updating a model.

services.name: ModelService
services.description:
Service for managing LLM models.
Allows clients to configure, list, update, and remove
different LLM models that the system can use.

methods.name: CreateModel
methods.description:
Creates a new model configuration.
Returns the created model resource.

methods.name: GetModel
methods.description: Retrieves a specific model's details by its resource name.

methods.name: UpdateModel
methods.description:
Updates a model's configuration.
Use a field_mask to specify which fields to update.

messages.name: Provider
messages.description:
Provider represents a configured Large Language Model provider.
It holds the necessary information to interact with a specific LLM,
such as its name and API key.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The unique resource name of the provider.
Format: "providers/{provider_id}"
The {provider_id} is a unique identifier for the provider.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description:
A user-friendly display name for the provider.
e.g., "My Local Model"

fields.name: api_key
fields.description:
The API key for authenticating with the provider.
This field is sensitive and should be handled securely.
It will be write-only (never returned in a Get or List request).

fields.name: api_endpoint
fields.description:
The API endpoint for the provider.
This is the URL where requests should be sent to interact with the LLM.

messages.name: CreateProviderRequest
messages.description: Request message for creating a provider.

fields.name: provider
fields.description:
The provider resource to create.
The `name` field should be left empty; the server will assign it.
`display_name` and `api_key` are required.

messages.name: CreateProviderResponse
messages.description: Response message for creating a provider.

messages.name: DeleteProviderRequest
messages.description: Request message for deleting a provider.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The resource name of the provider to delete.
Format: "providers/{provider_id}"

messages.name: DeleteProviderResponse
messages.description: Response message for deleting a provider.

messages.name: GetProviderRequest
messages.description: Request message for retrieving a provider.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The resource name of the provider to retrieve.
Format: "providers/{provider_id}"

messages.name: GetProviderResponse
messages.description: Response message for retrieving a provider.

messages.name: ListProvidersRequest
messages.description: Request message for listing providers.

fields.name: page_size
fields.description:
The maximum number of providers to return.
The service may return fewer than this value.
If zero, the server will pick an appropriate default.

fields.name: page_token
fields.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListProviders` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

messages.name: ListProvidersResponse
messages.description: Response message for listing providers.

fields.name: providers
fields.description: A list of configured providers.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: next_page_token
fields.description:
A token to retrieve the next page of results.
If this field is empty, there are no more results.

messages.name: UpdateProviderRequest
messages.description: Request message for updating a provider.

fields.name: provider
fields.description:
The provider resource with updated fields.
The `name` field is used to identify the provider to update.

fields.name: update_mask
fields.description:
The list of fields to be updated.
e.g., "display_name", "api_key"

messages.name: UpdateProviderResponse
messages.description: Response message for updating a provider.

services.name: ProviderService
services.description:
Service for managing LLM providers.
Allows clients to configure, list, update, and remove
different LLM providers that the system can use.

methods.name: CreateProvider
methods.description:
Creates a new provider configuration.
The `api_key` must be provided in the request.
Returns the created provider resource.

methods.name: GetProvider
methods.description:
Retrieves a specific provider's details by its resource name.
The `api_key` will not be returned in the response.
Returns the requested provider resource.

methods.name: ListProviders
methods.description:
Lists all configured providers.
The `api_key` will not be returned in the response.
Returns a list of provider resources.

Already uses a proper response message

methods.name: UpdateProvider
methods.description:
Updates a provider's configuration.
Use a field_mask to specify which fields to update.
You can update the `display_name` and `api_key`.
Returns the updated provider resource.

methods.name: DeleteProvider
methods.description:
Deletes a provider configuration permanently.
Returns an empty response on success.

fields.name: provider_name_query
fields.description: The query string to search for models.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: The maximum number of results to return.

fields.name: page_token
fields.description: The page token for pagination.

fields.name: models
fields.description: The list of models matching the search criteria.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: next_page_token
fields.description: The token to retrieve the next page of results.

methods.name: SearchModel
methods.description:
Searches for models based on the provided query.
Returns a list of models that match the search criteria.

enums.name: PermissionLevel
enums.description:
Indicates the sensitivity or criticality level required for a permission.
The level may be used by policy engines, reviewers, or UI to require stronger approval.
Values:
- PERMISSION_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED: Default value. Do not use.
- PERMISSION_LEVEL_MEDIUM: Standard operations with moderate impact.
- PERMISSION_LEVEL_HIGH: Operations with elevated risk or broader impact.
- PERMISSION_LEVEL_CRITICAL: Operations that can cause system-wide effects or data loss.

values.name: PERMISSION_LEVEL_HIGH
values.description: Operations with elevated risk or broader impact.

values.name: PERMISSION_LEVEL_CRITICAL
values.description: Operations that can cause system-wide effects or data loss.

enums.name: PermissionType
enums.description:
Enumerates the type of action a permission authorizes.
Values:
- PERMISSION_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default value. Do not use.
- PERMISSION_TYPE_EXECUTE: Grants ability to execute or invoke the resource (e.g., run a workflow).
- PERMISSION_TYPE_FILESYSTEM_READ: Grants read-only access to the file system.
- PERMISSION_TYPE_FILESYSTEM_WRITE: Grants write or modify access to the file system.
- PERMISSION_TYPE_NET_ACCESS: Grants network access.
- PERMISSION_TYPE_ALLOW_MCP: Grants permission to use the MCP AI service.
- PERMISSION_TYPE_ALLOW_ALL: Grants all permissions. Use with caution.

values.name: PERMISSION_TYPE_EXECUTE
values.description: Grants ability to execute or invoke the resource (e.g., run, trigger).

values.name: PERMISSION_TYPE_FILESYSTEM_READ
values.description: Grants read-only access to the file system.

values.name: PERMISSION_TYPE_FILESYSTEM_WRITE
values.description: Grants write or modify access to the file system.

values.name: PERMISSION_TYPE_ALLOW_MCP
values.description: Grants permission to use the MCP AI service.

values.name: PERMISSION_TYPE_ALLOW_ALL
values.description: Grants all permissions. Use with caution.

messages.name: AllowedPermission
messages.description:
Represents a set of permissions granted to a specific plugin function.
This message pairs a plugin function identifier with the list of permissions
that callers are allowed to exercise when invoking that function.

Fields:
- plugin_function_id: Identifier of the plugin function to which the permissions apply.
  Format: typically "package.function" or the plugin's internal function id. When used
  within a WorkflowCode, this id should match an entry in WorkflowCode.plugin_function_ids.
- permissions: The specific Permission values that are allowed for the given function.
  These should be as narrow as possible to adhere to the principle of least privilege.
  Example: granting only Permission{ resource: "secrets/my-secret", action: READ }

Notes:
- An AllowedPermission entry grants the listed permissions to code executing that
  plugin function; it does not automatically grant permissions to other plugin functions.
- Duplicates in permissions are allowed but have no extra effect; treat the list as a set.

fields.name: plugin_function_id
fields.description:
Identifier of the plugin function this permission set applies to.
This must correspond to a function exposed by one of the plugin packages listed
in WorkflowCode.plugin_packages or to a function id present in WorkflowCode.plugin_function_ids.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description:
Permissions that are allowed when invoking the specified plugin function.
Prefer specific Permission.resource and Permission.action combinations to minimize scope.
Example:
  permissions: [ { resource: "secrets/my-secret", action: READ } ]
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Permission
messages.description:
Describes a single permission requirement or grant for a specific resource.
Usage:
- Include in APIs (e.g., workflow or plugin definitions) to declare needed permissions.
- Use in policy evaluation to check whether a caller is authorized.

Fields:
- display_name: Human-readable name shown in UIs (e.g., "Read File").
- description: Longer explanation of the permission's purpose.
- permission_type: Action category (read, write, execute).
- resource: Resource identifiers this permission applies to. Free-form in v1.
- permission_level: Sensitivity level to inform review and approval.

Example:
  Permission {
    display_name: "Execute Workflow"
    description: "Runs the daily ETL pipeline"
    permission_type: PERMISSION_TYPE_EXECUTE
    resource: ["workflows/etl_daily"]
    permission_level: PERMISSION_LEVEL_HIGH
  }

Field behavior notes:
- display_name: Recommended.
- description: Recommended.
- permission_type: Required.
- resource: Optional; when omitted applies broadly.
- permission_level: Recommended; some features may require it.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description:
Human-readable name of the permission, suitable for display in UIs.
Example: "Read File", "Execute Workflow".

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Detailed description of what the permission allows and when it is used.
Keep concise but informative for reviewers and users.

fields.name: permission_type
fields.description:
The action category this permission authorizes.
Behavior: Required.

fields.name: resource
fields.description:
Resource identifiers this permission applies to.
Format: Free-form strings in v1 (e.g., "file.txt", "workflows/etl_daily", "buckets/logs").
Behavior: Optional. If empty, applies broadly and should be used with caution.
Example: ["projects/proj-123/locations/us/workflows/etl_daily"]
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: permission_level
fields.description:
The sensitivity or criticality level associated with this permission.
Behavior: Recommended. Some approval flows may require a minimum level.

messages.name: FunctionDefine

fields.name: parameters
fields.description:
The list of function parameters (arguments).
Order should match the function signature.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: returns
fields.description:
The return value(s) information. Optional: may be empty for void functions.
Multiple return values are supported (e.g., for tuple-like returns).
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: FunctionParameter
messages.description:
Represents a single parameter (argument or return value) of a function.
Stores the variable name, type, and description similar to JSDoc @param or @returns.

Fields:
- name: The variable name of the parameter.
- type: The type of the parameter (e.g., "string", "number", "object").
- description: A short description of what the parameter represents.

Example:
  FunctionParameter {
    name: "userId"
    type: "string"
    description: "The unique identifier of the user"
  }

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The variable name of the parameter.
Example: "userId", "message", "options".

fields.name: type
fields.description:
The type of the parameter.
Example: "string", "number", "boolean", "object", "Array<string>".

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short description of what the parameter represents.

messages.name: PluginFunction
messages.description:
Describes a callable function exposed by a plugin.
A function declares its purpose, identity, and required permissions for execution.

Fields:
- function_id: Stable unique identifier used by systems to reference the function.
- function_name: Human-friendly name suitable for UIs.
- description: Summary of what the function does and typical use cases.
- permissions: Permissions required for the caller to execute this function.
- function_define: JSDoc-style definition with parameters and return value.

Example:
  PluginFunction {
    function_id: "send_notification"
    function_name: "Send Notification"
    description: "Sends a message to a configured channel"
    permissions: [{ permission_type: PERMISSION_TYPE_EXECUTE, resource: ["channels/general"] }]
    function_define: {
      parameters: [{ name: "channelId", type: "string", description: "Target channel" }]
      returns: [{ name: "success", type: "boolean", description: "True if sent" }]
    }
  }

fields.name: function_id
fields.description:
Stable unique identifier for the function.
Behavior: Required. Must be unique within the plugin package.
Format: Plugin-scoped identifier (e.g. "send_notification").
        When referenced from AllowedPermission.plugin_function_id, it MAY be used
        either as this bare identifier or as part of a fully qualified name such
        as "package.send_notification".

fields.name: function_name
fields.description:
Human-friendly display name of the function.
Example: "Send Notification".

fields.name: description
fields.description: Short description of what the function does and when to use it.

fields.name: permissions
fields.description:
Permissions required to execute this function successfully.
Use Permission.resource to scope to specific entities as needed.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: function_define
fields.description:
JSDoc-style function definition with parameters and return value.
Contains structured information about function arguments and return type.

fields.name: version
fields.description:
Version of the function.

Behavior: Optional. When unset (empty string in proto3), the function is
considered versionless or uses a default/unspecified version. Callers MUST NOT
rely on this field always being populated.

Format: Semantic versioning "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH" (e.g., "1.0.0", "2.1.3") is
RECOMMENDED for clarity and consistency. Free-form strings are permitted but
discouraged as they complicate version comparison.

Uniqueness: The combination of (function_id, version) SHOULD be unique within
a PluginPackage. For example, "send_notification" v1.0.0 is conceptually
distinct from "send_notification" v2.0.0, allowing the plugin to expose both
versions simultaneously if needed.

Default behavior: When this field is not set, implementations typically treat
the function as the "default" or "latest" version of that function_id.

messages.name: PluginPackage
messages.description:
Represents a plugin package that can be installed into the platform.
A plugin groups one or more functions and includes metadata useful for discovery and governance.

Fields:
- package_id: Stable unique identifier of the plugin package.
- package_name: Human-friendly name of the plugin.
- package_version: Semantic version string (e.g., "1.2.3").
- description: Summary of the plugin's purpose and capabilities.
- functions: Functions exposed by this plugin.
- plugin_store_url: URL to the plugin page or documentation.
- internal_plugin: Indicates whether the plugin is internal-only.
- verified: Indicates whether the plugin is verified by the platform.

- deprecated: Indicates whether the plugin is deprecated and should not be used for new workflows.
- installed_at: Time when the plugin was installed.
- updated_at: Time when the plugin was last updated.

Example:
  PluginPackage {
    package_id: "notifications"
    package_name: "Notifications"
    package_version: "1.4.0"
    description: "Provides functions for sending notifications"
    plugin_store_url: "https://plugins.example.com/notifications"
    verified: true
    provider_id: "com.example"
    functions: [{ function_id: "send_notification", ... }]
  }

fields.name: package_id
fields.description:
Stable unique identifier for the plugin package.
Behavior: Required; unique across all installed plugins.
Format: Pure package name only (e.g. "sapphillon").

fields.name: package_name
fields.description:
Human-friendly name of the plugin package.
Example: "Notifications".

fields.name: package_version
fields.description:
Semantic version of the plugin package.
Format: "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH" (e.g., "1.0.3").

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the plugin's purpose and capabilities.

fields.name: functions
fields.description: Functions exposed by this plugin.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: plugin_store_url
fields.description:
URL to the plugin's store page or documentation.
Example: "https://plugins.example.com/com.example.notifications".

fields.name: internal_plugin
fields.description:
Whether this plugin is intended for internal use only.
Behavior: Optional. Defaults to false when unset.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: verified
fields.description:
Whether this plugin has been verified by the platform or publisher.
Behavior: Optional. Defaults to false when unset.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: deprecated
fields.description:
Whether this plugin is deprecated. New usage should be avoided.
Behavior: Optional. When true, UIs should display warnings.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: installed_at
fields.description: Time when the plugin was installed.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: Time when the plugin metadata or package was last updated.

fields.name: provider_id
fields.description:
The provider identifier of the plugin package.

Behavior: Optional. When unset (empty string in proto3), the provider is
considered unknown or uses a default platform provider. Callers MUST NOT
rely on this field always being populated.

Format: Reverse-domain-style identifier for the publisher or organization
that owns this plugin package (not the package itself).
Examples: "app.sapphillon", "com.example", "org.acme.plugins".

Relationship to package_id:
- provider_id identifies the provider/publisher.
- package_id identifies a specific plugin package.
- Multiple PluginPackage resources may share the same provider_id.

Note: This provider_id is conceptually distinct from the AI provider
resource IDs used in sapphillon.ai.v1 (e.g., "providers/{provider_id}").
It should not be confused or intermixed with those identifiers.

messages.name: InstallPluginRequest
messages.description: Request message for installing a plugin.

fields.name: uri
fields.description:
The URI of the plugin to install.

Required. This field must not be empty.

Security constraints:
- Only HTTPS-based URIs are allowed (e.g. https://example.com/plugin.pkg).
  Implementations MUST reject non-HTTPS schemes such as file://, http://,
  ftp://, ssh://, and other potentially dangerous or untrusted schemes.
- Servers SHOULD validate the host and path against an allowlist or
  blocklist of trusted plugin sources (e.g. known repositories or domains)
  before attempting to download or install the plugin.
- Servers MUST enforce reasonable limits on the size of the downloaded
  plugin package and on download time to mitigate resource exhaustion
  (e.g. maximum bytes, timeouts, and concurrent download limits).
- If a custom or repository-specific scheme is supported, its semantics
  and security properties SHOULD be documented and validated similarly.

If this field is empty or does not conform to the expected format/scheme,
the server MUST fail the request and return an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error
in the `status` field of `InstallPluginResponse`.

messages.name: InstallPluginResponse
messages.description: Response message for installing a plugin.

fields.name: plugin
fields.description:
The installed plugin package.

On success (`status.code == google.rpc.Code.OK`), this field contains
the fully installed plugin package.

On failure or partial installation (`status.code != OK`), this field
MUST NOT be relied upon and should be treated as unset/undefined by
clients. Implementations SHOULD leave this field empty in such cases.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Result of the install operation.

- `status.code == OK`: the plugin was installed successfully and
  `plugin` is populated with the installed package.
- `status.code != OK`: the install failed or only partially completed.
  In this case, clients MUST ignore `plugin`. Implementations MAY
  use `status.details` to convey additional information about any
  partial installation state (e.g., which step failed) rather than
  encoding partial state in `plugin`.

messages.name: ListPluginsRequest
messages.description: Request message for listing plugins.

fields.name: page_size
fields.description:
The maximum number of plugins to return.
The service may return fewer than this value.
If zero, the server will pick an appropriate default.

fields.name: page_token
fields.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListPlugins` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

messages.name: ListPluginsResponse
messages.description: Response message for listing plugins.

fields.name: plugins
fields.description: A list of available plugin packages.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: next_page_token
fields.description:
A token to retrieve the next page of results.
If this field is empty, there are no more results.

messages.name: UninstallPluginRequest
messages.description: Request message for uninstalling a plugin.

fields.name: package_id
fields.description:
The package ID of the plugin to uninstall.

Required. This must be the exact `package_id` of an installed plugin
as returned by `ListPlugins` or `InstallPlugin`.

If this field is empty or does not conform to the expected format, the
server MUST fail the request and return an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error in
the `status` field of `UninstallPluginResponse`.

If the specified package does not exist or is already uninstalled, the
server MUST return a `NOT_FOUND` error in the `status` field of
`UninstallPluginResponse`.

messages.name: UninstallPluginResponse
messages.description: Response message for uninstalling a plugin.

services.name: PluginService
services.description:
Service for managing plugins.
Allows clients to list and query available plugin packages
that can be used in workflows.

methods.name: ListPlugins
methods.description:
Lists all available plugin packages.
Returns a paginated list of plugin packages that can be installed or used.

methods.name: InstallPlugin
methods.description:
Installs a plugin from a given URI.

This API is experimental and is likely to change.

TODO:
- Repository support
- Checksum support
- Certificate support

Security considerations:
- Authentication and authorization: Callers must be authenticated and
  authorized to install plugins. This is typically an admin-only operation.
- Plugin signature verification: Implementations MUST verify plugin
  signatures before installation (see TODO for certificate support).
- Sandboxing: Installed plugins SHOULD be isolated/sandboxed to prevent
  unauthorized access to system resources.

Error conditions:
- INVALID_ARGUMENT: The URI is malformed, uses a disallowed scheme, or
  the plugin package is invalid.
- ALREADY_EXISTS: A plugin with the same package ID is already installed.
- PERMISSION_DENIED: The caller does not have permission to install plugins.
- FAILED_PRECONDITION: Version conflicts or dependency issues prevent
  installation.

On error, the `status` field of `InstallPluginResponse` is populated with
a corresponding `google.rpc.Status`.

methods.name: UninstallPlugin
methods.description:
Uninstalls a plugin by its package ID.

This API is experimental and is likely to change.

Security considerations:
- Authentication and authorization: Callers must be authenticated and
  authorized to uninstall plugins. This is typically an admin-only operation.

Error conditions:
- NOT_FOUND: The specified `package_id` does not correspond to any
  installed plugin.
- FAILED_PRECONDITION: The plugin is currently in use by one or more
  active workflows and cannot be uninstalled until those workflows are
  updated or terminated.
- PERMISSION_DENIED: The caller does not have sufficient permission to
  uninstall the plugin.

On error, the `status` field of `UninstallPluginResponse` is populated
with a corresponding `google.rpc.Status`.

messages.name: GetVersionRequest
messages.description:
Request for GetVersion.
This message is intentionally empty to allow future extensibility without breaking changes.

messages.name: GetVersionResponse
messages.description: Response for GetVersion.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The current application version.

messages.name: Version
messages.description:
Represents application version information.
The version string typically follows Semantic Versioning.

fields.name: version
fields.description:
The version of the application.
Format: "vMAJOR.MINOR.PATCH" with optional pre-release or build metadata
(e.g., "v1.2.3", "v1.2.3-alpha-1", "v1.2.3-beta.1").

services.name: VersionService
services.description:
Provides read-only application version information.
The service returns semantic version strings for display and compatibility checks.

methods.name: GetVersion
methods.description:
Returns the current application version.

Behavior:
- Unary RPC.
- Guaranteed to be fast and side-effect free.
- Suitable for health checks or compatibility gating.

Errors:
- Typically none; may return INTERNAL if the version cannot be determined.

enums.name: WorkflowLanguage
enums.description:
Enumerates supported workflow source languages.
Used to indicate the language of WorkflowCode.code.

enums.name: WorkflowResultType
enums.description:
Classifies the outcome of a workflow execution.
Values:
- WORKFLOW_RESULT_TYPE_SUCCESS_UNSPECIFIED: Execution completed successfully.
- WORKFLOW_RESULT_TYPE_FAILURE: Execution failed (see exit_code and description).

messages.name: Workflow
messages.description:
Represents a workflow entity including its code history and execution results.

Fields:
- id: Stable identifier for the workflow.
- display_name: Human-readable name.
- description: Purpose and summary of the workflow.
- workflow_language: Preferred or primary language used by this workflow.
- workflow_code: History of code revisions (latest may be last element or determined externally).
- created_at: Time the workflow was created.
- updated_at: Time the workflow was last modified.
- workflow_results: Historical execution results for this workflow.

Notes:
- Keep workflow_code revisions append-only to preserve history.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Stable identifier for the workflow.
Format: UUID.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Human-readable name for the workflow.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the workflow's purpose and behavior.

fields.name: workflow_language
fields.description: Preferred or primary language used by this workflow.

fields.name: workflow_code
fields.description: History of workflow code revisions.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Creation time of the workflow.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: Last update time of the workflow.

fields.name: workflow_results
fields.description: Historical execution results for this workflow.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: WorkflowCode
messages.description:
Represents a specific revision of workflow source code and metadata.

Fields:
- id: Stable identifier of the workflow code entity.
- code_revision: Monotonic integer representing the code version within the workflow.
- code: The source code text.
- language: The language of the code.
- created_at: Timestamp when this code revision was created.
- result: Optional preview or last run result associated with this code revision.
- required_permissions: Permissions required to run this code (declared by the author).

Notes:
- code_revision should increase by 1 for each new revision of the same workflow.
- required_permissions should be kept minimal and specific to support principle of least privilege.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Stable identifier of the workflow code entity.
Format: UUID.

fields.name: code_revision
fields.description:
Monotonic integer representing the code version within the workflow.
Behavior: Required. Starts at 1 and increments with each change.

fields.name: code
fields.description: The workflow source code.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The programming language of the source code.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Creation time of this code revision.

fields.name: result
fields.description:
Optional result previews or cached outputs associated with this code revision.
Behavior: Optional. May be empty when no run has occurred. Can store multiple results.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: plugin_packages
fields.description:
Plugin packages that this workflow code depends on.
This allows the workflow to use functions defined in these plugins.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: plugin_function_ids
fields.description: Plugin functions that this workflow code directly uses.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: allowed_permissions
fields.description: Allowed permissions for this workflow code.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: WorkflowResult
messages.description:
Captures the result of running a workflow at a specific code revision.

Fields:
- id: Identifier of the result record.
- display_name: Human-friendly name for UIs (e.g., "Nightly Run 2025-08-05").
- description: Summary of the execution and relevant details.
- result: Raw result payload or textual summary.
- ran_at: Time the execution completed.
- result_type: Success or failure classification.
- exit_code: Process exit code when applicable (0 for success).
- workflow_code_revision: The code revision that produced this result.
- workflow_result_revision: Monotonic revision of this result record itself.

TODO: Add structured data types for results (logs, metrics, artifacts).

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Identifier of the result record.
Format: UUID.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Human-friendly name for display.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Summary of the execution and relevant details.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Raw result payload or textual summary of the run.

fields.name: ran_at
fields.description: Time the execution completed.

fields.name: result_type
fields.description: Success or failure classification.

fields.name: exit_code
fields.description: Process exit code when applicable (0 for success).

fields.name: workflow_result_revision
fields.description: Monotonic revision of this result record.

messages.name: FixWorkflowRequest
messages.description: Request to fix a workflow definition using a problem description.

fields.name: workflow_definition
fields.description:
The workflow definition to be fixed.
Format: JSON, YAML, or another structured text representation.
Behavior: Required; must be parseable by the service.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Description of issues to fix or constraints to apply.
Example: "Step IDs must be unique; add retry to notification step."
Behavior: Required; must be non-empty.

messages.name: FixWorkflowResponse
messages.description:
Server-streamed response carrying fixed workflow definitions and a change summary.
The final message typically represents the complete fixed definition.

fields.name: fixed_workflow_definition
fields.description: The fixed workflow definition.

fields.name: change_summary
fields.description:
Summary of changes applied to produce the fixed definition.
Example: "Renamed duplicate step IDs; added retry policy to 'notify'."

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The status of the response.
If the status is not OK, it indicates an error.

messages.name: GenerateWorkflowRequest
messages.description: Request to generate a workflow from a natural language prompt.

fields.name: prompt
fields.description:
Natural language prompt describing the desired workflow.
Example: "Check the weather, and if it's raining, send me a notification."
Behavior: Required; must be non-empty.

fields.name: model_name
fields.description:
The name of the model to use for generation.
Format: "models/{model_id}"
Behavior: Optional; if not specified, the default model will be used.

messages.name: GenerateWorkflowResponse
messages.description:
Server-streamed response containing the generated workflow definition.
Each streamed message may be partial; the client should merge or replace as appropriate.

fields.name: workflow_definition
fields.description: Structured workflow definition.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The status of the response.
If the status is not OK, it indicates an error.

messages.name: OrderByClause
messages.description: Order by clause

fields.name: field
fields.description: Field name to order by (e.g. "display_name", "updated_at")

messages.name: RunWorkflowRequest
messages.description: Request to run a workflow by ID.

fields.name: by_id
fields.description: Run a workflow by its ID and code ID.

fields.name: ai_model_name
fields.description:
Optional AI model name to use for this run.
If not specified, the default model will be used.
The name should match a model from `sapphillon.ai.v1.Models.name`.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: RunWorkflowResponse
messages.description:
Response after running a workflow.
Contains the result of the workflow execution and status.

fields.name: workflow_result
fields.description: The result of the workflow execution.

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The status of the response.
If the status is not OK, it indicates an error.

messages.name: WorkflowSourceById
messages.description: Specifies a workflow to run using its ID and code ID.

fields.name: workflow_id
fields.description: The ID of the workflow to run.

fields.name: workflow_code_id
fields.description: The ID of the workflow code to run.

services.name: WorkflowService
services.description:
Generates and fixes structured workflow definitions from natural language descriptions.
Methods stream partial outputs to allow progressive rendering in UIs and long-running processing.

methods.name: GenerateWorkflow
methods.description:
Generates a workflow from a natural language prompt.

Behavior:
- Server-streaming RPC that emits partial or incremental workflow definitions.
- The client should read until the stream completes to obtain the final definition.

Responses:
- Each message may represent a partial draft or an updated full definition.

Errors:
- INVALID_ARGUMENT if the prompt is empty or malformed.
- INTERNAL for unexpected generation errors.

methods.name: FixWorkflow
methods.description:
Fixes an existing workflow definition using a description of issues.

Behavior:
- Server-streaming RPC that emits suggested fixes and updated definitions incrementally.
- The final message in the stream typically represents the fully fixed definition.

Errors:
- INVALID_ARGUMENT if workflow_definition or description is empty.
- FAILED_PRECONDITION if the definition cannot be parsed.
- INTERNAL for unexpected processing errors.

methods.name: RunWorkflow
methods.description: Runs a workflow based on the provided definition.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
